text: It has now been a full year since the last case of community transmission in Western Australia.

elements.text: It has now been a full year since the last case of community transmission in Western Australia.

text:
I mean, I am stuck in the UK.
Which is epically bad  (I am still not over the fact that they subsided people to eat in restaurants over summer. Dine-in only).
I can count on my fingers  with some to spare the number of people I've interacted with in person in the last year.

Meanwhile, my friends back home are talking about how they were enjoying the local equivalent of Burning Man.
A week long, 1500 person party.

Meanwhile, my friends back home are talking about how they were enjoying the local equivalent of Burning Man.
A week long, 1500 person party.

text: (just out of curiousity (asking for a friend?) what's that local equivalent of Burning Man called? (presumably in Australia))

elements.text: (just out of curiousity (asking for a friend?) what's that local equivalent of Burning Man called? (presumably in Australia))

text: Wow a full year since community based transmission? That's surreal. It might also feel strange for people in such places to be watching people in other places struggling a lot with COVID and community transmission
